thread.title: Wes Morgan escapes potential UEFA probe for goal celebration in Leicester's win over Sevilla
thread.title_full: Wes Morgan escapes potential UEFA probe for goal celebration in Leicester's win over Sevilla

author: James Whaling
title: Wes Morgan escapes potential UEFA probe for goal celebration in Leicester's win over Sevilla
text:
Sport Wes Morgan escapes potential UEFA probe for goal celebration in Leicester's win over Sevilla The centre-half scored the opener as the Premier League side won 2-0 on the evening to secure a 3-2 aggregate victory Share Wes Morgan has escaped punishment for his celebration (Photo: Laurence Griffiths / Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester skipper Wes Morgan has escaped a UEFA probe over his goal celebration in the Foxes' Champions League win over Sevilla. 
The centre-half scored the opener as the Premier League side won 2-0 on the evening to secure a 3-2 aggregate victory and book their place in the last eight. 
And the Foxes stopper mocked looking through a telescope when the ball hit the back of the net in honour of his personal sponsor Captain Morgan. 
But UEFA have decided the celebration did not break their sponsorship regulations. Morgan scores the opener (Photo: Michael Regan) 
Players playing in the Champions League and Europa League are prohibited from advertising companies and their products other than the competitions' official sponsors. 
Nicklas Bendtner fell foul of the rules when he sported a pair of Paddy Power branded pants during Euro 2012. 
Captain Morgan quickly spotted the celebration and tweeted from the official account. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
